title: Ralf Little will ‘replace Ardal O’Hanlon’ on BBC’s Death In Paradise
text:
Ralf Little has reportedly signed up for Death In Paradise (Picture: Chris Jackson/Getty Images)

Ralf Little has been cast as Ardal O’Hanlon’s replacement in Death In Paradise, according to reports.

The 39-year-old actor, known for starring in The Royle Family, has reportedly signed up as the next policeman in the hit BBC drama.

Speaking to The Mirror, a source said: ‘Ralf has already started work solving strange deaths on the show and we think fans will love him.’

Metro.co.uk has reached out to the BBC for comment.

Ardal O’Hanlon is leaving Death In Paradise (Picture: BBC)

Ardal decided to step down from his role as D.I. Jack Mooney to ‘explore other opportunities’ after being on the show for three years.

If true, Ralf will be the fourth lead character on Death In Paradise, following in the footsteps of Ardal, Kris Marshall and Ben Miller.

The show recently teased the announcement of Ardal’s replacement, showing a man on a hammock looking out to sea.

Is that Ralf Little? (Picture: BBC)

Alongside The Royle Family, Ralf is known for playing Jonny on Two Pints Of Lager And A Packet Of Crisps and was previously a semi-professional footballer.

Death In Paradise is available on BBC iPlayer.
